intro: Trixis lessingii var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth trixis, is a perennial herb native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to full sun, making it a hardy species in desert environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of local flora and a subject of study in ecological research.
